document_data.name: Balsam
document_data.mainbody: '''Balsam''', also referred to as '''jewelweed''', was a group of flowering plants that blossomed in high elevations, often shedding their colorful petals to be carried by wind for miles.

Availability.Uses: Balsam ointment was used to clean wounds. Partially burned balsam leaves had a sweet and smoky fragrance. They were ground into ash and combined with special [[salt]]s to stabilize the mix and brew it into ''[[potions of greater healing]]''.

document_data.Notable Users: * Auntie [[Ethel]]: a [[hag]] disguised as a kind old herbalist lady who lived in the Western Heartlands ''circa'' [[1492 DR]].
